Articles.Content: If you've seen this thing launch, you know what I'm referring to. The H-IIB lets out a beastly whine that sounds like a turbine during the first 30-45 seconds of launch. I've searched all over the net and can't find the answer, but does anyone here know what exactly causes that? The closest I've ever heard in another launcher was a more low pitch roar from the Space Shuttle. Otherwise, no other rocket sounds like this. The engineering geek in me needs to know, because I think it sounds amazing!
Likely the combustion chamber and nozzle design contribute to the output frequency
And here was I thinking this tread was about how stupid the HIIB is as a rocket system.

jonrd463,

If you mean this whine:

, that's caused by the turbopump.

Best,

-Slashy

Slashy-

Is that the same as this whine? It's pretty distinct. https://youtu.be/lAE4zqu8YHU?t=65
Yea the Japenese rocket screams like a bottle rocket for some reason. I was about to make a thread about this myself. Would could be the purpose of that? Just because it sounds cool?

1 hour ago, Motokid600 said:

Yea the Japenese rocket screams like a bottle rocket for some reason. I was about to make a thread about this myself. Would could be the purpose of that? Just because it sounds cool?

Lol, I wouldn't put it past the Japanese. I mean,  they DID build a full-size Gundam.

2 hours ago, jonrd463 said:

Slashy-

Is that the same as this whine? It's pretty distinct. https://youtu.be/lAE4zqu8YHU?t=65

I guess you'd have to tell me the answer to that one. It sounds the same to me.

Best,
